channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping & rodent feeding., 2nd January
item.description:
There is a significant amount of fly-tipped waste on the pavement and roadside, including cardboard, household rubbish, and discarded furniture/appliances on Glenister Road. This waste is obstructing the footway and creating an unsightly and unsafe environment. This has been a constant issue for years in particular by the tree. The waste is removed and then more is added the following day. In addition, food appears to be regularly left out to feed birds. This is attracting rodents and increasing the risk of infestation. The combination of dumped rubbish and food waste poses a public health concern for local residents. I request urgent removal of the waste, investigation into the fly-tipping, and action to address bird feeding that is contributing to vermin problems. Photograph attached.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Caletock Way, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice on Tyron Way hill blocking cars and emergency vehicles, 2nd January
item.description:
Icy road overnight causes untold problems given your blockage of high street and all traffic diverted in Tyron Way. Photo shows fire engine trying to get down hill. Firemen resorted to putting their own sand on road to allow access. This road needs to be salted in ice conditions especially when you block a major junction like high street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Tyron Way, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars not using bays and parking to close to resident drive ways, 2nd January
item.description:
Vehicles are continually not using the parking pays and parking inches away from residents dropped curb drive ways making it difficult for residents to enter and exit their drive ways safely. Can double red lines replace the single faded yellows that are currently there please.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eltham Green Road, Eltham

item.title: 16 inch wide pothole on left side, facing South., 2nd January
item.description:
There are 3 potholes in Court Road opposite Sequana Maritime. The pothole closest to the traffic light is wide and deep. It is causing damage to vehicles and is a serious health and safety issue for bicycles and motorbikes. In low level light the potholes can not be easily seen and is dangerous.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Court Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Perimeter railing piece missing, 2nd January
item.description:

item.title: Uncollected autumn leavesâ€¦., 2nd January
item.description:
Ongoing issue of insufficient attention/care to the pick up and removal of autumnal leaves leading to break down to slippery mud, especially in vicinity of high pedestrian footfall St Nicholasâ€™s primary school and nearby The Crown PH as well as north end of road near Royal Parade. Whilst parked cars are undoubtedly an issue sections of the road which are yellow lined are also not (adequately) sweptâ€¦.. See attached 8am Sunday 1 January photosâ€¦.

item.title: Unwanted items? Let's throw them in the street! outside n 40 Wellington Gardens, 2nd January
item.description:
Clothes, rubbish and various items left in front of n 40 Wellington Gardens. They've been there since Friday I believe. It's a mess and it looks like a dump. If there's a chance someone living at n 40 is reading, there are places where you can bring those items ( charities or thrift shops), or they can be collected ( for free). More rubbish incoming soon.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wellington Gardens, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet
